text: about three years ago I was in a fatal
bus crash in India after the vehicle
flipped off the highway and two people
died I try not to tell this story
often because I still have flashbacks
and nightmares about it since that day I
haven't stepped on a long-haul bus
because street safety has become an
alarming concern for me
India's neighboring country is
Bangladesh which I had the chance to
visit in April last year we're here at
Newmarket one of the oldest markets in
Bangladesh
I loved Bangladesh and all the amazing
sights delicious foods and kind people
but much like India I was shocked by the
hectic unregulated and extremely unsafe
road both sides of the road it was like
the chaos of Delhi or Bombay times 5 in
terms of honking horns horrible drivers
and overall safety today I'd like to use
my platform to bring awareness to
something happening right now in Dhaka
which is virtually going unnoticed on
the news because the government shut
down the internet last week to students
in Dhaka got hit by a speeding bus and
were killed every day since then
thousands of students have hit the
streets to demand for safer roads they
blocked several major intersections and
rallied in rainy weather to make their
voices heard
yesterday alone more than a hundred
students as young as 13 years old were
injured after police fired rubber
bullets and tear gas at them and the
death count is rapidly rising instead of
listening and giving the students
justice the government shut down the
internet and phone services and the
police denied how they treated these
students thanks to thousands of messages
and emails I've received from
Bangladeshis the word quickly got out to
me there is a like almost four thousand
people died last year on the road
accident we can't take it anymore ban
one thing I know for sure is that the
roads in Bangladesh need to be fixed
immediately or else bigger problems are
bound to keep happening I am a victim of
a severe bus crash and nobody else
whether it be in Bangladesh Thailand
Brazil or the States should have to fear
death when entering the road
[Music]
